newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's April CPI up 1.62 percent.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's April CPI up 1.62 percent.

text.p: BOGOTA, May 2 Reuters - Colombia's consumer price index rose 1.62 percent in April, the smallest monthly gain in 19 years, compared with 1.97 percent in the same month last year, the National Statistics Department said Friday.
The rise in the index is running at 8.18 percent for the first four months of the year, 1.84 percent lower than the same period last year, the department said.

The cumulative rise in the consumer price index for the last 12 months is now running at 18.52 percent, the statistics department said. Inflation for all of 1996 hit 21.63 percent. The central bank has set a target of 18 percent for this year.

The statistics department said the figure had been driven up by a 3.51 percent increase in health care costs in April, a 2.08 percent gain in the cost of housing and a 2.05 percent rise in transport costs.
The rate, however, was restrained by small rises in education, up 0.51 percent, clothing 0.84 percent and food 1.22 percent.
The biggest rise in the consumer price index was seen in the Caribbean port city of Barranquilla, whewre it was up 2.5 percent.
April's consumer price index rose 1.36 percent in Bogota, down from the 1.97 percent in April 1996, the statistics department said.
